citation.title: No linkage of P187S polymorphism in NAD(P)H: quinone oxidoreductase (NQO1/DIA4) and type 1 diabetes in the Danish population.

comment.text: The enzyme apparently serves as a quinone reductase in connection with conjugation reactions of hydroquinons involved in detoxification pathways as well as in biosynthetic processes such as the vitamin K-dependent gamma-carboxylation of glutamate residues in prothrombin synthesis.
NAD(P)H + a quinone = NAD(P)(+) + a hydroquinone.

Homodimer (PubMed:10543876, PubMed:10706635, PubMed:11735396, PubMed:11587640, PubMed:16700548). Interacts with PDLIM4 isoform 2; this interaction stabilizes PDLIM4 isoform 2 in response to oxidative stress and protects it from ubiquitin-independent degradation by the core 20S proteasome (PubMed:21636573).
The Ser-187 polymorphism may be linked to susceptibility to forms of cancers.
Quinone reductase accepts electrons from both NADH and NADPH with equal efficiency.
Belongs to the NAD(P)H dehydrogenase (quinone) family.

comment.name: Atlas of Genetics and Cytogenetics in Oncology and Haematology
